Comment: > Weddings at labor Camps are fucked up.   This makes me wonder: should our discomfort stop at places we're culturally close to? What about global landmarks also built on slavery, exploitation, atrocities and stolen wealth. Like the Cathedral of Seville enriched by colonial gold, the Great Wall of China built through slave labor and death, Chichen Itza shaped by human sacrifice, or Belgian palaces funded by Congo's suffering? I'm not saying it's all the same, but maybe the deeper question is how we honor truth and treat places that exist today because of the suffering others went through for those places to exist - and are now places we go to appreciate their beauty or meditate or take pictures.
